Dear Matt Smith
Thank you for your request on 2 February 2022 for information about Fourth
Street’s development options for the Central Library and Graves Art
Gallery. We acknowledged it on 4 February 2022 with a deadline of response
of 2 March 2022. We apologise for failing to respond to your request
within the 20 day deadline required by section 10 of the Freedom of
Information Act 2000. This was due to staffing issues, which meant we
could not follow up the initial processing of your request. Since your
prompt of 5 May 2022, we have found the information you have requested and
respond  below.
*Full details of Fourth Street's agreed remit to review and recommend
development options for Sheffield Central Library and the Graves Gallery.
The appointment of Fourth Street was through the Council’s Capital
Delivery Partner Framework with Turner and Townsend (T&T). T&T were tasked
with finding an appropriate consultant through their framework with the
following brief.
Sheffield City Council has been exploring options for the future direction
of their library service for a number of years and are now looking to
agree upon a direction of travel.
Over the last 5 years the council has employed a number of consultancies
to look at the service; its vision and values, what a 21^st century
service looks like for Sheffield, how the service can be improved, design
concepts for the physical environment, etc. and they now require a
specialist consultant to critically review the work undertaken to set out
some evidence based options for the future of the service in Sheffield
which a focus on the physical space in which it uses.
The specialist consultant would be required to:
• Critically review the relevant work undertaken to date which includes
work by Arup, DCA, Human City and others.
• Set out a number of options for the future direction of the service.
Please note that this will include options for the location of the
central library service.
• Facilitate a workshop with senior council staff to review and
challenge the options and agree a direction of travel.
• Set out a high level delivery plan for preferred option including
costs / resources / timescales ( a lot of this information will be
drawn from the existing reports)
The council has asked Turner & Townsend to setup this exercise and we are
wondering if you would be interested in putting forward a proposal for
this exercise?
*Any documents detailing Fourth Street’s recommended development options
for Sheffield Central Library and the Graves Gallery
We are attaching Fourth Street’s report (August 2019) and update (August
2021).
If you have any queries about this response, please do not hesitate to
contact us.
The information provided in this response is available for re-use under
the terms of the Open Government Licence v3.0. The terms of the OGL can be
found [1]here. When re-using the information, Sheffield City Council
requires you to include the following attribution statement: “Contains
public sector information obtained from Sheffield City Council and
licensed under the Open Government Licence v3.0.”
If you are unhappy with the response you have received in relation to your
request, you are entitled to have this reviewed. You can ask for an
internal review by replying to this email. Internal review requests should
be submitted within 40 working days from the date of this response.
If you remain dissatisfied with the outcome of your internal review, you
can contact the Information Commissioner’s Office. Please see
[2]
https://ico.org.uk/make-a-complaint/offi...
for further details.
Kind Regards,
Sheffield City Council

Sheffield, S1 1UJ
